text:
I'd say it depends on "what" you're watching.
For instance:
If I watch the whole theme folder, everything I add to it will automatically will be uploaded to HS. If I watch only a certain module (folder) everything outside of it won't get uploaded (which makes sense).

So what I do is:
I open a new VSCode window, navigate to the root folder of my theme and type in something like
`hs watch --account=HUBID local-theme-folder remote-theme-folder`
it is definatly the entire folder.
i can add single files but when i add a module it does not “see it”
using the VS code menu that is.
If I create it using the cli it works fine.
And I know that doesnt make sense. :~

okay... can confirm - same error here. Thought it was because i was on an older(5.x) beta version of the cli, but after updating it to the newest 6.x version, it's the same... I'll ask a few HubSpotters if they know something
great time fo rthis to happen when starting a new project :+1:
I am trying to get back on here more often.

*HubSpot extension < > VS Code*
• _*anyone having issue with fetch in HubSpot extension panel?*_ from last 3+ weeks I am unable to fetch files using  *HubSpot extension > Remote File System* > *Right click* > *Fetch*
    ◦ I have message if file is there that it will be replaced, even have message `Finished download`  but the file/folder keeps being empty 
CLI is working, can download any folder into any folder
• `hs fetch  module1 module1`

Looks like th emodule issue was theer was added an additional .module older added to the module with the file in it when you create a new module. when you take the files from the .module folder it works as a short term fix.

The extension is so buggy. Html + HubL has NEVER worked properly and the fetch/create/watch via the interface is messy. 

I gave up and I don't even use it anymore :upside_down_face:

I understand that. But I would think that HubSpot would want their dev partners to have good tooling. Also I think based on the updates and teh issues in GH This was a result of the last update on 9/3.
Yeah, I mean I just use the CLI. What can the extension do that it can't?
Make the workflow easier. I mean, a right-click is easier than navigating via code and have separated terminals...
